title: Khaleda petitions HC to change trial court of Orphanage Trust graft case
text:
Khaleda petitions HC to change trial court of Orphanage Trust graft case Staff   14:00:38.0   14:00:38.0 BdST BNP chief Khaleda Zia has pleaded in High Court to change the trial court for the Zia Orphanage Trust graft case citing lack of confidence in the judge. 
Her counsel Mahbub Uddin Khokon submitted the documents on Wednesday to Supreme Court's concerned wings. 
Khokon said the matter might be heard by the bench of justices Md Ruhul Quddus and Bhishmadev Chakrabortty on Monday. 
The Zia Orphanage Trust and Zia Charitable Trust graft cases are being tried in the court of Dhaka's Third Special Judge Abu Ahmed Jamadar. 
The court is now hearing Khaleda's statement defending herself over the charges levelled by the Anti Corruption Commission (ACC). 
In her petition with the High Court, Khaleda accused Judge Jamadar of scheduling hearings hurriedly, sometimes even twice a week, which is not the case in her other trials. 
Khaleda's counsel had petitioned the trial court seeking a fresh probe in the Orphanage Trust graft charges. 
But before hearing the matter on Feb 2, Judge Jamadar moved to hear Khaleda's defence statement. 
When her lawyer moved a motion of no-confidence against the judge, he scrapped both the pleas -- for a fresh probe and no-confidence -- and asked how the defendant pleads in the case, guilty or not. 
The court adjourned then after fixing Feb 9 for the next hearing. 
In 2008, the ACC filed the case against Khaleda, her son Tarique Rahman and four others. 
The trial began after the court indicted them in March 2014. 
They stand accused of embezzling Tk 21 million from funds meant for the trust, which reportedly came from a foreign bank. 
Of the other defendants, former MP Kazi Salimul Haque Kamal and businessman Sharfuddin Ahmed are out on bail while on Jan 26, a warrant was issued for Tarique, who has been in the UK for the last nine years and has warrants on him in several others cases. 
The two others accused in the case -- former principal secretary to the PM Kamal Uddin Siddique and one Maminur Rahman, nephew of BNP founder Ziaur Rahman, are absconding.
